description:
The nefarious Squid Girl is back to continue her self-appointed mission to invade the surface world. Or that's what she would do, if she could just stop getting distracted by squidding movies, reading squidly manga, and making friends as only a squid could make them. Squid Girl must overcome not only danger found at every turn, but her own squidly good nature as well.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: The Invader Comes From the Bottom of the Sea!

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

name.native: シンディー・キャンベル

node.description: **Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

__[Website](http://kikuyatomoki.com/)__

__Birthplace:__ Mitaka, Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Tomoki Kikuya is a Japanese composer and arranger, who works for music studio Popholic. His brother Kikuya Hiroki (菊谷宏樹), is the director of TVK's saku saku music show.

__Biography:__
Kikuya started a career as guitarist in the music band Mustang A.K.A under Sony Records. Later he was part of Funanori. Starting from 2005 Kikuya decided to focus on working as a music composer and arranger. He has arranged and composed several songs featured in anime since then, starting with theme songs for Pani Poni Dash.

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Profile](http://www.pro-baobab.jp/ladies/kanemoto_h/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kanemoto-hisako)

Hisako Kanemoto was raised in Okayama Prefecture and attended Kamogata High School. Upon graduation, she enrolled in the voice acting course at the Vocational School of Art College Kobe. After completing her education in 2008, she moved to Tokyo and joined the training office associated with Production Baobab agency.

Early in her career, Kanemoto used the pseudonym _Juri Aikawa_. She made her anime debut in [Sora no Manimani](https://anilist.co/anime/6098) in 2009 under this name. After landing the lead role in [So Ra No Wo](https://anilist.co/anime/6802) To the following year, Kanemoto announced that she would be using her real name in her works moving forward. She was also cast as the title character in [Shinryaku! Ika Musume](https://anilist.co/anime/8557) later that year.

After a breakthrough 2010, Kanemoto was named Best New Actress at the 5th Seiyuu Awards. She has also voiced a number of mascot characters from Okayama Prefecture because of her origin.

Kanemoto made her debut as a solo musical artist in 2014 under Victor Entertainment with the album Fantastic Voyage.

On May 26, 2018 she announced on her official blog that she will take hiatus from professional activities for studying abroad. Her agency Production BAOBAB confirmed her return to work in March 2019.

__Non-anime roles:__

[Official Website](http://www.planet-sphere.jp/main.php) | [Portal Square Website](https://sphere.m-rayn.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sphere_PS) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVtovl8b4hJT2X-_gS1VTOA) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sphere_(Japanese_band)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/スフィア_(声優ユニット))

Sphere is a Japanese seiyuu idol group managed by Sony Music Entertainment's Music Ray'n subdivision.

The group took a short hiatus in 2017, but resumed activities in 2019.

__Members:__
• [Haruka Tomatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/95890/)
• [Minako Kotobuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101634/)
• [Ayahi Takagaki](https://anilist.co/staff/95823/)
• [Aki Toyosaki](https://anilist.co/staff/95599/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yasukiti01)

__Hometown:__ Anjo, Aichi Prefecture, Japan

Yasutaka Yamamoto debuted as a storyboard maker and a producer with episode 34 of Idaten Jump (2005) after working as an assistant producer for My Melody (2005) He then worked as an assistant director for The Orphans of Simitra (2008), and debuted as a director with Valkyria Chronicles the following year. Since then, he has worked on many productions as a director, storyboard maker, and producer. Some of these titles include: Actually, I Am… (2015), Hinomaru Sumo (2018), and Nekopara (2020).

_Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤道廣)

Founder and representative director of Sound Ring.
**Satoshi Oosedo** is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.
**Satoshi Oosedo** is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - Who's up for a squid-vasion? / Hold on a squid, aren't you a compatriot? / Aren't I just the squiddiest?
Episode 2 - Wait a squid, aren't you on my side? / Up for a squid-celebration? / Wanna play with this squid?
Episode 3 - Aren't you a fraidy-squid? / You're the squid's sworn enemy, aren't you? / Squidzooks! Aren't you a new recruit?
Episode 4 - How much is that squiddy in the window? / Ride 'em, Squiddy! / You're phonier than an 11-tentacled squid!
Episode 5 - Not from this sea, are you? / Why not join the school of fish? / Wouldn't having a pet be squidtastic?
Episode 6 - Up for an inkredible Hero Stage Show? / Squidn't you be studying right now? / Is this inkfatuation or love?
Episode 7 - Focus your tentacles on her! / Feeling inkuisitive? / A squiddle work never killed anyone.
Episode 8 - Aren't you a squiddle under the weather? / Ink that a new ability? / Squidn't you bring an umbrella?
Episode 9 - Wanna doorbell ditch, squiddo? / Can squids put on make-up? / Holy squid! Is that a secret weapon?
Episode 10 - Isn't that a Teru Teru bosquid? / What squidsn't there to like? / One! Two! Three squids, you're out!
Episode 11 - I ink that's a doll? / Isn't that fishy? / Squids to match my mountains.
Episode 12 - You feeling lucky, squid? / Quite the squidicament we're in. / An even worse squidicament!
